{"step_by_step_thinking": "CA72-4 is a tumor marker that can be elevated in certain types of cancer, including ovarian cancer. However, it is not specific to ovarian cancer and can also be elevated in other conditions, including endometriosis. Therefore, while it may be useful in indicating the presence of a disease, it may not be useful in differentiating between ovarian endometrioma and epithelial ovarian cancer.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
